result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
No contact direct or indirect with Wal-Mart, co-Defendant. Not to enter into any stores without consent of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Court questions Defendant re: PTAC. Defendant understands. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of restitution payments made by Defendant, wasn't able to pay it all due to car problem. State advises that restitution has been paid in full. Defense requests hearing in January.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense thought case was set for status, not plea, advises of payments made, requests plea in 3 weeks.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers asks court to adjourn matter for 60 days to allow defendant time to prepay remainder of restitution/fine/costs to take advantage of the State's offer to reduce charge to a misdemeanor. State has no objection to continuance. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Change of Attorney

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is attempting to pay restitution in order to get amendment to misdemeanor. Discussion regarding how money will get paid.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court. Attorney Eric S. Maciolek appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/10/14.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with KS, Sturgeon Bay Wal-Mart.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Sarah J Kaczmarowski in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
